page.title: 12THE MUSEUM IN BARNARD CASTLE
page.content: The Bowes Museum is an unusual building to find in a town like Barnard Castle.It is a large French chateau,built by John Bowes in 1869 to keep his large collection of treasures .It now belongs to Durham County Council and has pottery,paintings , furniture and tapestries worth millions of pounds.People come from all over the world to see them. St. Mary's school is only a few minutes walk away,so we often visit it, especially the Teesdale rooms with the Roman exhibits and local crafts.We helped to collect money when they were buying two Canaletto paintings.They also have a Goya and an El Greco.The French style flower beds at the front are lovely,and you can walk all round. You can play bowls or tennis if you belong to the club.{
